lines.text:
[speaking about 'Crocodile' Dundee]
Do you know who that was?
No.
Clint Eastwood.
Tell me, Sue, what is Mick like in bed?

[cleverly brushing off the question]
I dunno, he still sleeps on the floor.

[about Mick breaking into Rico's mansion/fortress]
What are ya chances?
Fair.
What are your chances of getting out of here with that jacket on?

[throws his knife across the room into the punk's mohawk]
Better than average.
[Aborigine speaks in Aborigine]
No, mate, we just hold them.
What did he say?

[winking]
He wants to know if we're allowed to eat these men.
What did you do last night?
We didn't do nothing. We was here all night.
"We went out to Long Island to help this lunatic storm a fortress!" At the very least you can come watch me get my head blown off.
G'day, amigo.
Who do you think you are? You hold me here at gunpoint, threaten to kill people, then you act like you're some sort of rock star? You're a drug dealer. You're a grubby little parasite.
You should watch your mouth. It is not wise to annoy me. Bob Tanner did and I had his head blown off like that...
[snaps his finger softly]
You killed Bob?
And if your Mick screws this up...
[snaps his finger softly]
Get some sleep. Gonna be a long day tomorrow.

[hiding and watching their campsite, he whispers]
Yeah. And it' ll be a long night, too.
I'm about to throw myself off this building.
You could kill yourself.
That's the whole idea.
Oh, ah, right. I'll just wait till you're finished.
[after several moments when the Ledge Suicider does not jump]
Would you mind getting a move on? I'm on me lunch break.
Are you really enjoying that?

[eating fire-roast bat]
Nah - needs garlic.
You shot Walter.
Yeah. It was the only thing I could think of to save his life.
I've been looking for Walter Reilly. Haven't seen him around, have you?
You shoulda brought a gun instead of a beer, mate.
Nah. I don't need one. I got a Donk.
Got a what?
Donk.
There's nothing wrong with the food, it's the company.
Mick - be careful. This isn't a game.
It is to me.
You ready to go home now?
I am home.
If Mick want his clothes back, he can climb down there and get it his bloody self.
Wanna give me some help?
Would Bonnie say no to Clyde?
Who?
You know, some people say that he talks to the animals. The aborigines call him Jabba-Jahda-Ah-Der-Ahd, which means The Crocodile Who Walks Like a Man.

[chuckles]
If what you say is true, it's lucky we brought the Kryptonite.

[to suicidal ledge-walker]
Just out of curiosity, why would you want to - - pssshhheeewwwww?
[makes whistling sound and gestures with his arm in a diving motion]
Now we're all on foot. That makes us even.
Seven to two is "even"?
Mick's bloody lucky you can't shoot straight, Wal.
This Dundee likes to play games, huh, Miguel? Maybe we show him some good games when it gets light.
You want me to lead them to Jaba Point?
Do you know where they are?
Yeah. About 500 yards that way, over that ridge.
How do you know that?
Can't you smell it?
Their sweat?
Wally's aftershave.
